intro: Koanophyllon ayapanoides, commonly known as the Ayapanoides leaf plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow, and often hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in composite heads. It thrives in rocky or well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
